nodes.bodyText:
Previously the test for upgrade was: connection != endPoint.getConnection()
Now it is just 101 response status.   Don't we support upgrade like paths (eg for http2) that are not 101s?

@gregw but this class is the HTTP/1.1 specific implementation so it cannot be anything else than 101.
The reason to not do the check to see if the connection was upgraded already is because the 101 response may be finished before the request, so the upgrade did not happen yet (but we know it will since it's a 101).

This is now printing the whole stack trace, while before it was only a line.
I am not convinced that we should log this at WARN level, because any I/O error due to the other peer will show up as a big stack trace in the logs.
I'd change warn() to debug().
I agree, we already give this error to the websocket endpoint with processConnectionError so no reason to warn here.
Why do you need the NPE guard now?
While reproducing this bug I was occasionally getting some ReadPendingException from fillInterested(), and we call this after we have already released the network buffer so it was null.
